12/1/24: Proposal on shareholder activism regarding human rights violations in Palestine for the ACSRI, annotated

Instead of taking consensus to mean a significant enough population on campus supports the aims of the proposal, the authors of the proposal argue that consensus lies in Columbia’s ethical values and commitment to socially responsible investing.

The authors emphasize that the proposal is about the use of shareholder rights to pressure companies. The authors assert that there is no significant opposition to exercising this shareholder right in relation to human rights violations in the campus community nor among alumni.

Referencing the consensus threshold directly, the authors claim that ACSRI has indicated that consensus does not mean “universal or near-universal agreement.”

12.1.24 Divestment from Israel and Businesses Linked to Violations of Human Right- ACSRI Proposal, annotated

The authors of this proposal make a similar argument to the shareholder proposal—that the University’s commitment to socially responsible investing and its core ethics should be all of the consensus that ACSRI needs. This proposal goes further to claim that these commitments on the part of the University make counterarguments "illegitimate."

This proposal directly notes ACSRI’s rejection of CUAD’s 2023 proposal on the basis of a lack of consensus, highlighting what the authors perceive as the inconsistency of the decision with prior ACSRI decisions.

The authors of the proposal make the claim that the presence of at least some visible opposition on campus has not stopped ACSRI in the past.

12/1/24: Proposal on divestment from companies linked to “gross violations of human rights and international law,” annotated

This proposal takes a different approach by not specifically targeting Israel or Palestinian rights, mimicking one of the three divestment proposals the University offered to expedite through the ACSRI during April 2024 negotiations. The word “Israel” appears in the proposal only once, and the word “Palestine” does not appear in the proposal. Seven references to “Gaza” appear in the footnotes, but never in the text of the proposal.

The writers emphasize that the consensus for the proposal lies in the basic ethical principles of the University.

Source: Spectator reporting, ACSRI proposals

Graphics by Ava Fung
